intro: Jacquemontia pringlei, commonly known as the Pringle's morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many vines and herbs known for their showy flowers. The plant produces trumpet-shaped, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the morning, hence its common name. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Jacquemontia pringlei is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
